conclusion: Point charge +q is at A(0,0,h) in vacuum (z > 0), region z ≤ 0 is an infinite conductor, conductor is in electrostatic equilibrium
Image charge has equal but opposite charge -q and is located at the mirror position across the boundary (0,0,-h)
Electric field at any point will be the sum of fields from the original charge +q at (0,0,h) and the image charge -q at (0,0,-h)
Distance from original charge to point (h,h,-h) is h√6
Distance from image charge to point (h,h,-h) is h√2
Electric field vector from original charge +q is kq/(6h^2) in direction of r_1
Electric field vector from image charge -q is -kq/(2h^2) in direction of r_2
Only need to consider E_2 from the image charge, which represents the effect of all induced charges in the conductor
The magnitude of the electric field formed by the induced charges at the point (h,h,-h) is kq/(2h^2)
